cards.name: Snivy
cards.text: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

cards.name: Snivy
cards.text: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Servine
cards.text: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Servine
cards.text: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Serperior
cards.text: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

abilities.name: Royal Heal

cards.text: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

attacks.name: Leaf Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Pansage
cards.text: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

cards.name: Simisage
cards.text: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage and heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Lilligant
cards.text: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now confused.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

cards.name: Maractus
cards.text: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Maractus
cards.text: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

attacks.name: Constant Rattle
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 60 damage.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Deerling
cards.text: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Sawsbuck
cards.text: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

attacks.name: Nature Power
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to both your and your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tepig
cards.text: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

cards.text: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pignite
cards.text: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

cards.name: Pignite

attacks.name: Flamethrower

cards.name: Emboar
cards.text: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

cards.text: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

cards.name: Pansear
cards.text: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

cards.name: Simisear
cards.text: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

attacks.name: Flame Burst

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Darumaka
cards.text: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

cards.text: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue, then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Oshawott
cards.text: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

cards.text: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Samurott
cards.text: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.text: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

cards.name: Panpour
cards.text: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

cards.name: Simipour
cards.text: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

attacks.name: Scald

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Basculin
cards.text: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Ducklett
cards.text: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food—peat moss.

cards.name: Swanna
cards.text: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Alomomola
cards.text: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

cards.name: Alomomola
cards.text: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Blitzle
cards.text: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

cards.name: Blitzle
cards.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Zebstrika
cards.text: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it's angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Zebstrika
cards.text: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Electrispark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Joltik
cards.text: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Joltik
cards.text: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Galvantula
cards.text: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.name: Electroweb

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Munna
cards.text: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Musharna
cards.text: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Woobat
cards.text: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

cards.name: Swoobat
cards.text: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Venipede
cards.text: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

cards.name: Whirlipede
cards.text: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Scolipede
cards.text: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponent and poison them.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Solosis
cards.text: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.

attacks.name: Cell Culture
attacks.text: Search your deck for Solosis and put it into your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Duosion
cards.text: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thought, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Timburr
cards.text: It fights by swinging a piece of timber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

cards.name: Timburr
cards.text: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

cards.name: Gurdurr
cards.text: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.

attacks.name: Bulk Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 20 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Throh
cards.text: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.

attacks.name: Circle Throw
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Storm Throw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Sawk
cards.text: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

cards.name: Sandile
cards.text: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Krookodile
cards.text: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Krookoroll
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sucker Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Scraggy
cards.text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

cards.name: Scrafty
cards.text: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

attacks.name: Spit Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

cards.name: Zorua
cards.text: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Zoroark
cards.text: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Foul Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Vullaby
cards.text: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Mandibuzz
cards.text: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Punishment
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Klink
cards.text: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Klang
cards.text: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Klinklang

abilities.name: Shift Gear
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watches for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: They make the patterns on their bodies shine in order to threaten predators. Keen eyesight lets them see in the dark.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lillipup
cards.text: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Lillipup
cards.text: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Herdier
cards.text: It loyally follows its Trainer's orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Stoutland
cards.text: This extremely wise Pokémon excels at rescuing people stranded at sea or in the mountains.

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Pidove
cards.text: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Tranquill
cards.text: It can return to its Trainer's location regardless of the distance separating them.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Unfezant
cards.text: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Audino
cards.text: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Minccino
cards.text: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Cinccino
cards.text: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Bouffalant
cards.text: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Bouffalant
cards.text: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.text: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: PlusPower
cards.text: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokédex
cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Communication
cards.text: Reveal a Pokémon in your hand and put it on top of your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Professor Juniper
cards.text: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Revive
cards.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.text: This is an extremely rare Pikachu card. You're very lucky to have found it!
